intro: Pedicularis rostratocapitata subsp. rostratocapitata, commonly known as the rostrated capitata lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is characterized by its distinctive, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many hemiparasitic species. It grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, often in rocky or gravelly soils. Its morphology includes erect stems with opposite, ovate leaves and a unique floral structure that facilitates pollination by insects.
